question: Do you think this food would be popular in other countries?
transcript: No, I do not think so because the ingredients, there is a lot of ginger and there is a lot of Korean ingredients which is very awkward to other foreigners.

anti_overrating.reason: 'Korean ingredients which is' (which are). 'awkward to' (strange to? awkward usually implies social situations or physical clumsiness, but can mean strange/uncomfortable).

ielts_descriptor_alignment.grammar_text: Makes some errors in grammar and punctuation.

question: Okay, what are the types of food that people eat in your country?
transcript: In my country, people really like to eat hot soup with rice because usually Koreans are very busy, so they have to cut off the time even, even if, even the mealtime, during the mealtime. So if you just mix the rice with the soup, you do not have to chew it, and so you can decrease the amount of time that you spend on your meal.

anti_overrating.reason: 'cut off the time' (cut down on time / save time).

ielts_descriptor_alignment.vocabulary_text: Uses a sufficient range of vocabulary.

question: What kinds of foreign food are popular in your country?
transcript: I think the most popular food from foreign countries is fried chicken. There is a lot of fried chicken restaurants in Korea. Even there is some kind of common sense that if you do not know what to do at future, then you can just, frying chicken.

anti_overrating.reason: 'common sense' (common belief / joke?). 'at future' (in the future). 'you can just, frying chicken' (start frying chicken / open a fried chicken shop).

ielts_descriptor_alignment.grammar_text: Attempts to use complex sentences but these tend to be less accurate.

question: Okay, in your country is it important to have a meal together?
transcript: It was very common in the past when I was in elementary school, but it is been a long time to be, to take a meal with my whole family because we have all different occupations so we have to be separated. And it is also common to the other families from my friends.

anti_overrating.reason: 'it is been a long time to be, to take a meal' (it has been a long time since we took a meal / since I took a meal). 'common to the other families' (common for other families).

ielts_descriptor_alignment.grammar_text: Makes some errors in grammar and punctuation.

question: Would you say food is better now than in the past?
transcript: I think it is similar because there is, we can share our recipes easier than before, but every, every cookers and every good recipes was already developed. So I think the overall level of that food was not increased or decreased.

anti_overrating.reason: 'every cookers' (cooks). 'every good recipes was' (every good recipe was).

ielts_descriptor_alignment.grammar_text: Makes some errors in grammar and punctuation.

question: Do you think our diet is important?
transcript: Definitely. For example, when you buy a new car, you have to put some good oils. But if you want to maintain that car for a long time, it is same. If I just use a metaphor, we are a car and that food is oil. So we have to eat good food for maintain our body health for a long time.

ielts_descriptor_alignment.grammar_text: Makes some errors in grammar and punctuation.

question: Balanced diet?
transcript: I think balanced diet is just eat various types of carbohydrates and fatty acids and proteins as much as possible. Okay how are the eating habits in your country different from eating habits in the past It was not that different but only difference is that people usually do not eat rice than before because there is a lot of globalizations already occurred So we know there is a lot of tasty food without rice, but at the past we always eat food with rice. So we called the Korean terminology meal as rice, same as rice.

anti_overrating.reason: 'balanced diet is just eat' (is just eating). 'do not eat rice than before' (eat less rice than before). 'lot of globalizations' (globalization). 'at the past' (in the past). 'meal as rice' (meal 'rice').

ielts_descriptor_alignment.grammar_text: Makes some errors in grammar and punctuation.

question: Okay, and how might eating habits change in coming decades?
